sentences.english: He became garrulous after a few glasses of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他幾杯酒下肚之後便嘮嘮叨叨說個沒完。

sentences.english: Joy kept yacking (on) about the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊嘮嘮叨叨地聊著婚禮的事。

sentences.english: She was prating of her responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 她嘮嘮叨叨地傻談責任。

sentences.english: This lawyer verbalizes and is rather tedious.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師嘮嘮叨叨，單調乏味。

sentences.english: His mother kept on chivvying him to get his hair cut.
sentences.chinese: 他母親一直嘮嘮叨叨地催他去理髮。

sentences.english: She is really a pill, spending whole day harping and complaining.
sentences.chinese: 她真煩人，整天嘮嘮叨叨的。

sentences.english: I wish you'd stop harping on me.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你別在我面前嘮嘮叨叨的。

sentences.english: She nagged at him all day long.
sentences.chinese: 她成天嘮嘮叨叨地找他岔子。

sentences.english: He blabbed so much I couldn't hear the telephone.
sentences.chinese: 她嘮嘮叨叨，我聽不清電話。

sentences.english: Listening can be more valuable than being a chatterbox.
sentences.chinese: 與其嘮嘮叨叨，不如多傾聽。

sentences.english: She's always going on about her various illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 她老是嘮嘮叨叨地訴說她患的多種疾病。

sentences.english: She's always harping on my faults.
sentences.chinese: 她總是嘮嘮叨叨地談我的過失。

sentences.english: Someone likes beating his gums no matter where and when.
sentences.chinese: 有人就是喜歡嘮嘮叨叨的，無論何時，不分地點。

sentences.english: Ku prattled away, even dragging in the bed plank incident.
sentences.chinese: 顧爾謙還嘮嘮叨叨地牽涉適才牀板的事。

sentences.english: He listened to the old man prosing away.
sentences.chinese: 他聽着那老人嘮嘮叨叨講個沒完。

sentences.english: You mustn't chatter nonsense on serious diplomatic occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在嚴肅的外交場合你可不能嘮嘮叨叨地胡說一氣。

definition: to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
